subject: Additional classes in test package cause errors
msgSnippet: Hi, I m using JUnit 4 and Mockito together.  I ve built a stub of an object to enable the testing of another class.  To support the stub I ve written a class
messageBody:
Hi,

I'm using JUnit 4 and Mockito together. I've built a stub of an object to enable the testing of another class. To support the stub I've written a class (implementing Answer for those familiar with Mockito) as a standalone class rather than as an anonymous inner class, for readability.

JUnit doesn't like my standalone helper class. I get two errors: "Test class should have exactly one public zero-argument constructor" and "No runnable methods".

I must have something configured incorrectly but I can't find what that might be. What am I doing wrong? How do I keep JUnit from objecting to my test support classes?

Thanks,

Paul
